intro: Trigonostemon huangmosu, commonly known as the Huangmosu tree, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is often found in moist, forested areas and is valued for its ornamental appearance. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in shaded environments.
